Curator's comments: Published in Edward William Lane's (1836) 'An Account of the Manners and Customs of the Modern Egyptians' p. 202
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Acquisition notes: Af,+.1731.a to 1800 were all collected by Edward William Lane while he was in Egypt between 1825 and 1828 and again in 1835. The publication of his 'Manners and Customs of the Modern Egyptians' followed in 1836, in which some of the objects were engraved and many described. They were purchased by A W Franks and given to the BM in June 1883. The slip for the first item gives the initials RSP as the source of the collection. This must stand for Reginald Stuart Poole, Lane's nephew, who was Keeper of the Department of Coins and Medals at the BM from 1870 to 1893 and acted as his uncle's literary executor. The owner of the works was Lane's widow.
